unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities News Snippet: Solar Rooftop Subsidies**
normalised: **Energy and Utilities News Snippet: Solar Rooftop Subsidies**

unnormalised: Good news, folks! Thinking of going solar on your roof? The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) is still offering sweet subsidies! Imagine, finally saying goodbye to hefty electricity bills just in time for Diwali.
normalised: Good news, folks! Thinking of going solar on your roof? The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E) is still offering sweet subsidies! Imagine, finally saying goodbye to hefty electricity bills just in time for Diwali.

unnormalised: The scheme's been extended, so you can still snag a decent chunk of change back if you install solar panels. Think of all the savings you could put towards a grand Onam feast or that extra helping of biryani!
normalised: The scheme's been extended, so you can still snag a decent chunk of change back if you install solar panels. Think of all the savings you could put towards a grand Onam feast or that extra helping of biryani!

unnormalised: Reports from the Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) suggest these subsidies can cover up to 40% of the installation cost for rooftops under 3kW. For larger systems (up to 10kW), you can still get a subsidy but the percentage dips a bit.
normalised: Reports from the Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (I R E D A) suggest these subsidies can cover up to forty percent of the installation cost for rooftops under three kilowatt. For larger systems (up to ten kilowatt), you can still get a subsidy but the percentage dips a bit.

unnormalised: Talk to your local solar installer. They can help you navigate the paperwork and figure out if your building in, say, Chennai or even a small village near Madurai, qualifies.
normalised: Talk to your local solar installer. They can help you navigate the paperwork and figure out if your building in, say, Chennai or even a small village near Madurai, qualifies.

unnormalised: Don't delay! Last date for registration is fast approaching, and you donâ€™t want to miss out on the chance to save some serious Rs. Let's light up our homes sustainably this festive season! This initiative aims to add another 1000 MW of rooftop solar capacity pan-India. The scheme offers subsidy upto Rs 14,588/kW.
normalised: Don't delay! Last date for registration is fast approaching, and you do not want to miss out on the chance to save some serious rupees. Let's light up our homes sustainably this festive season! This initiative aims to add another one thousand megawatt of rooftop solar capacity pan-India. The scheme offers subsidy up to rupees fourteen thousand five hundred and eighty eight per kilowatt.
